items.name: Accidental Baby Acquisition
items.description: Characters unexpectedly end up caring for a baby, often leading to bonding or domestic hijinks.

items.name: Accidental Marriage
items.description: Characters unknowingly get married or are surprised to find themselves wed due to drunken mistakes or cultural mishaps.

items.name: Age Difference
items.description: A relationship where there is a significant age gap between characters, often leading to power dynamic discussions.

items.name: Aliens Made Them Do It
items.description: Characters are forced into sexual situations due to alien influence, often involving mind control or cultural customs.

items.name: Alpha/Beta/Omega
items.description: Characters are part of a social structure based on dominance, neutrality, or submission—often involving heat cycles and mating.

items.name: Amnesia
items.description: One or more characters suffer memory loss, often leading to rediscovery of identity or love.

items.name: Arranged Marriage
items.description: Two characters are bound in a romantic or sexual relationship due to family or societal arrangements, often with initial resistance.

items.name: Bed Sharing
items.description: Characters are forced to share a bed, often due to circumstances like only one bed available, sparking sexual tension or cuddles.

items.name: Bonding (trope)
items.description: Characters form an emotional or magical bond, sometimes involuntarily, with implications for intimacy and loyalty.

items.name: Canon Divergence AU
items.description: The story follows canon until a certain point where it diverges into a different path.

items.name: Fake/Pretend Relationship
items.description: Characters pretend to be in a romantic relationship, often to deceive others, only to develop real feelings.

items.name: Friends to Lovers
items.description: Characters who start as close friends slowly fall in love, usually with lots of pining and miscommunication.

items.name: Harem (trope)
items.description: A single character is pursued or surrounded by multiple love interests, often involving jealousy and rivalry.

items.name: Love Confession
items.description: A character finally confesses romantic or sexual feelings to the other, often after tension builds.

items.name: Mutual Pining
items.description: Both characters secretly long for each other but believe the feelings aren’t returned, leading to slow burn tension.

items.name: Soulbond (trope)
items.description: Characters are magically or spiritually connected in a way that often influences emotions, sensations, or destiny.

items.name: Soulmates
items.description: Characters are destined to be together, often marked by a magical or cosmic connection.

items.name: Unresolved Sexual Tension
items.description: Sexual or romantic tension between characters that remains unfulfilled for extended periods, often with near-kisses and longing stares.

items.name: Aliens Made Them Do It
items.description: Characters are forced into sexual situations due to alien influence, often involving mind control or cultural customs.

items.name: Alpha/Beta/Omega
items.description: A dynamic where characters are assigned social/biological roles—Alphas dominate, Betas are neutral, and Omegas are submissive and often go into heat.

items.name: Butterflyverse
items.description: A trope derived from alternate realities or timelines where one small change leads to vastly different events, often with sexual consequences.

items.name: Dead Dove: Do Not Eat
items.description: A tag warning that the content includes dark, potentially triggering material (like incest, non-con) that won't be treated lightly or resolved.

items.name: First Time (genre)
items.description: Stories where a character is experiencing sex for the first time, often with a focus on emotional or physical reactions.

items.name: Friends With Benefits
items.description: Characters engage in sexual activity without romantic commitment, though feelings often complicate things.

items.name: Fuck or Die
items.description: Characters must have sex or face dire consequences, often seen in magical, sci-fi, or cursed scenarios.

items.name: Heat Fic
items.description: Usually in A/B/O settings, a character enters 'heat' and must have sex, often urgently and repeatedly.

items.name: Mission Sex
items.description: Characters engage in sex as part of or during a mission—either for disguise, information, or stress relief.

items.name: Morning After (trope)
items.description: Scenes following a sexual encounter, often dealing with consequences, emotional fallout, or new intimacy.

items.name: One Night Stand (trope)
items.description: A single sexual encounter between characters, typically with unexpected consequences or emotional complexity.

items.name: PWP
items.description: Short for 'Plot? What Plot?'—stories that exist only to showcase sex scenes with minimal or no story.

items.name: Reverse Harem
items.description: One character (usually female) is the romantic/sexual focus of multiple other characters.

items.name: Rude Interruption
items.description: Sex is interrupted—often for comedic or dramatic effect—by another person or circumstance.

items.name: Unresolved Sexual Tension
items.description: Build-up of mutual attraction and near-sexual encounters between characters that remain unfulfilled.

items.name: We're Not Gay, We Just Love Each Other
items.description: Two male characters have intense emotional and sexual bonds but deny or struggle with labeling it gay.

items.name: Weepy Uke Syndrome
items.description: Typically in yaoi, the submissive male (uke) is overly emotional, fragile, and constantly crying.

items.name: Silvertongue (trope)
items.description: A character seduces others through skilled or manipulative speech, often leading to sexual success.

items.name: Abuse
items.description: Explores physical, emotional, or sexual abuse—usually tagged to warn for dark content.

items.name: Accidental Baby Acquisition
items.description: Characters unexpectedly end up caring for a baby, often leading to bonding or domestic hijinks.

items.name: Accidental Marriage
items.description: Characters unknowingly get married or are surprised to find themselves wed due to drunken mistakes or cultural mishaps.

items.name: Age Difference
items.description: A relationship where there is a significant age gap between characters, often leading to power dynamic discussions.

items.name: Aliens Made Them Do It
items.description: Characters are forced into sexual situations due to alien influence, often involving mind control or cultural customs.

items.name: Alpha/Beta/Omega
items.description: Characters are part of a social structure based on dominance, neutrality, or submission—often involving heat cycles and mating.

items.name: Amnesia
items.description: One or more characters suffer memory loss, often leading to rediscovery of identity or love.

items.name: Arranged Marriage
items.description: Two characters are bound in a romantic or sexual relationship due to family or societal arrangements, often with initial resistance.

items.name: Bed Sharing
items.description: Characters are forced to share a bed, often due to circumstances like only one bed available, sparking sexual tension or cuddles.

items.name: Bonding (trope)
items.description: Characters form an emotional or magical bond, sometimes involuntarily, with implications for intimacy and loyalty.

items.name: Canon Divergence AU
items.description: The story follows canon until a certain point where it diverges into a different path.

items.name: Fake/Pretend Relationship
items.description: Characters pretend to be in a romantic relationship, often to deceive others, only to develop real feelings.

items.name: Friends to Lovers
items.description: Characters who start as close friends slowly fall in love, usually with lots of pining and miscommunication.

items.name: Harem (trope)
items.description: A single character is pursued or surrounded by multiple love interests, often involving jealousy and rivalry.

items.name: Love Confession
items.description: A character finally confesses romantic or sexual feelings to the other, often after tension builds.

items.name: Mutual Pining
items.description: Both characters secretly long for each other but believe the feelings aren’t returned, leading to slow burn tension.

items.name: Soulbond (trope)
items.description: Characters are magically or spiritually connected in a way that often influences emotions, sensations, or destiny.

items.name: Soulmates
items.description: Characters are destined to be together, often marked by a magical or cosmic connection.

items.name: Unresolved Sexual Tension
items.description: Sexual or romantic tension between characters that remains unfulfilled for extended periods, often with near-kisses and longing stares.

items.name: Alien Abduction
items.description: Characters are kidnapped by aliens—sometimes for probing, sometimes for breeding, sometimes for comedy.

items.name: Alternate Reincarnation
items.description: Characters are reincarnated in new lives, retaining or rediscovering past connections.

items.name: Altpower
items.description: Canon characters have alternate superpowers or abilities not present in the original work.

items.name: Angels
items.description: Supernatural beings of divine origin—sometimes benevolent, sometimes terrifying—often involved in taboo or cosmic sex.

items.name: Animal Transformation
items.description: Characters shift into animals or are cursed to do so—can be symbolic, magical, or sexy.

items.name: Anywhere But Here (genre)
items.description: A desire to escape reality—characters yearn to be elsewhere, physically or emotionally.

items.name: Apocalypse AU
items.description: Set in a post-civilization world—zombies, viruses, nuclear fallout—where survival alters relationships.

items.name: Artificial Intelligence
items.description: Characters are AIs or interact with sentient machines—can involve robotic sex, ethics, or programming-based dynamics.

items.name: Asexuality
items.description: One or more characters identify as asexual; may explore intimacy, identity, and relationships without sex.

items.name: Bleeds
items.description: A trope where injuries—often minor ones—occur in emotionally or sexually charged scenes, sometimes used symbolically.

items.name: Denialfic
items.description: A character is in denial about their feelings, identity, or reality—often leads to internal conflict and pining.

items.name: Didn't Know They Were Dating
items.description: Characters behave like a couple without realizing they are one until others point it out.

items.name: Dissociation
items.description: A character detaches from reality or emotions, often portrayed during trauma or high stress, sometimes tied to sexual content.

items.name: Divorce Fic
items.description: Characters deal with divorce—either from each other or with it as a backdrop to the story.

items.name: Documentation
items.description: Fics presented as reports, transcripts, or meta-texts—form shapes the story, often humorously or for worldbuilding.

items.name: Domestic
items.description: Focuses on everyday home life and intimacy—often fluffy, comforting, or quietly romantic.

items.name: Dominance Hierarchy
items.description: A setting or relationship governed by dominance structures—can be societal, pack-based, or psychological.

items.name: Don't Ask Don't Tell (trope)
items.description: Characters hide their relationship or identity due to institutional or societal pressure, often tied to the military.

items.name: Doppelganger (trope)
items.description: A character meets an identical version of themselves—used for tension, identity crisis, or sexual exploration.

items.name: Dream (trope)
items.description: The events happen in a dream or dream-like state—may be symbolic, erotic, or unreliable.

items.name: Endverse
items.description: Post-apocalyptic setting based on an alternate timeline—usually derived from a specific canon’s dark future.

items.name: Enemies to Lovers
items.description: Characters begin with animosity and end up falling for each other through tension, conflict, and chemistry.

items.name: Enemy to Caretaker
items.description: An enemy is forced to care for a hurt or vulnerable protagonist, often leading to intimacy and softened hostility.

items.name: Epistolary Fic
items.description: Told through letters, messages, or journals—can reveal character secrets and desires in unique ways.

items.name: Established Relationship
items.description: Characters are already together when the story begins—focuses on the dynamics of an existing relationship.

items.name: Ever so slightly longer but not quite as thick
items.description: A humorous or sensual comparison of sexual anatomy—usually tongue-in-cheek.

items.name: Everybody Lives
items.description: An alternate outcome where no major characters die, often used as fix-it or feel-good content.

items.name: Everyone Is Gay
items.description: A fandom trope where all characters are reimagined as queer, sometimes humorously or idealistically.

items.name: Everyone Is Related
items.description: A twist or headcanon where characters turn out to share familial ties—used seriously or for crack.

items.name: Evil Twin
items.description: A character faces a version of themselves who is evil—used for dramatic tension, mistaken identity, or kink.

items.name: Eye Sex
items.description: Characters exchange intense, loaded glances that practically drip with unspoken sexual tension.

items.name: Fairy Tale AU
items.description: Characters are placed in fairy tale settings or retellings—complete with magic, curses, and archetypes.

items.name: Fake/Pretend Relationship
items.description: Characters pretend to be in a romantic relationship—often leading to real feelings.

items.name: Fever Dream
items.description: Surreal or disjointed sequences, often symbolic, erotic, or hallucinatory.

items.name: Finding Out
items.description: A character discovers something important—often another’s feelings, identity, or secret past.

items.name: First Kiss
items.description: Focus on a character’s first romantic kiss—charged with tension and emotion.

items.name: First Meeting
items.description: Depicts the moment characters meet—potential for instant chemistry or clashing.

items.name: Fix-it
items.description: Rewrites canon events to change negative outcomes—usually saving a character or relationship.

items.name: Flashback (glossary term)
items.description: Scenes that look into characters’ pasts, often to reveal emotional baggage or key memories.

items.name: Flower Symbolism
items.description: Uses flowers to metaphorically represent characters’ emotions, relationships, or fates.

items.name: Forbidden Love
items.description: A romance that is taboo or impossible due to social, familial, or political barriers.

items.name: Force Bond
items.description: Two characters are mystically or psychically linked—often leads to intimacy and shared sensations.

items.name: Forced Marriage
items.description: Characters are made to marry against their will—can explore slow-burn romance or power imbalance.

items.name: Forced Proximity
items.description: Characters are stuck in close quarters (trapped, snowed in, etc.)—sparks or tension ensue.

items.name: Friendship
items.description: Explores deep platonic bonds—often a foundation for hurt/comfort or emotional growth.

items.name: Fuck or Die
items.description: Characters must have sex or face fatal consequences—common in fantasy or sci-fi smut.

items.name: Futurefic
items.description: Set far beyond current canon—explores future relationships, children, or dystopian futures.

items.name: Gateroom Orgy
items.description: Stargate fandom-specific trope involving group sex by or around the Stargate—crack or smut.

items.name: Gay Chicken
items.description: Characters escalate homoerotic dares until someone ‘chickens out’—used for tension or revelation.

items.name: Genderfuck
items.description: Defies or blurs gender roles and expression—often involves trans or nonbinary characters and kink.

items.name: Genderswap
items.description: Characters are swapped to another gender—temporarily, permanently, or in an AU.

items.name: Get 'em
items.description: A story where a character is injured and others must rescue, tend to, or worry about them.

items.name: Get Together (trope)
items.description: Focuses on the moment or journey where characters become romantically or sexually involved.

items.name: Ghost (trope)
items.description: A character is a ghost or interacts with one—can be tragic, creepy, or sexy.

items.name: Glitch (trope)
items.description: Reality or systems behave erratically—used in digital AUs or psychological horror settings.

items.name: Glowfic
items.description: A writing format using color-coded character dialogue, often collaborative and sexually intense.

items.name: Gold Sickness
items.description: Inspired by Tolkien—characters driven mad by greed or magical corruption.

items.name: Gore
items.description: Graphic depictions of violence or bodily harm—may be horror or kink-related.

items.name: Gothic Fiction
items.description: Dark, moody atmosphere with crumbling mansions, madness, ghosts, and tragic passion.

items.name: Grief
items.description: Focus on mourning and emotional fallout—often cathartic, sometimes romanticized.

items.name: Groundhog Day
items.description: A character relives the same day repeatedly—can lead to despair, humor, or sexual experimentation.

items.name: Grumpy Character and the Sunshine Character
items.description: One brooding, stoic character paired with an overly cheerful one—opposites attract.

items.name: Guys Crying
items.description: Explicit focus on male emotional vulnerability—often a turn-on or cathartic beat.

items.name: Hanahaki Disease
items.description: A fictional illness where unrequited love causes flowers to grow in a character's lungs—tragic, poetic, and metaphorical.

items.name: Happy and Unhappy Endings
items.description: Stories that highlight either bittersweet or emotionally satisfying conclusions—sometimes both.

items.name: Harem (trope)
items.description: A single character is pursued romantically or sexually by multiple others, often with rivalry among them.

items.name: Huddling for Warmth
items.description: Characters forced to cuddle or share body heat due to cold—leads to bonding or awkward arousal.

items.name: Hurt/Comfort
items.description: One character is emotionally or physically hurt, and another cares for them—often leads to intimacy or healing.

items.name: Hurt/Hurt
items.description: Both characters are suffering, with no immediate relief—focuses on shared trauma and emotional collapse.

items.name: Hurtcomfortverse
items.description: A setting where hurt/comfort dynamics are central or institutionalized—pain as premise.

items.name: I Can Change Them
items.description: A character believes they can redeem or heal a 'bad' or morally grey love interest through love.

items.name: I Love My Car, Spaceship, Ship, Whatever
items.description: Characters express emotional or even romantic/sexual attachment to inanimate or sentient vehicles.

items.name: I Want to See Your Face
items.description: A sexually or emotionally charged line/trope where one character craves intimacy or eye contact.

items.name: I'm Not Okay (I Promise)
items.description: A nod to emotional instability—character isn't coping well, often a prelude to emotional plot or angst.

items.name: Identity Porn
items.description: One or both characters are unaware of each other’s true identities—often used for tension or slow-burn.

items.name: Idiots in Love
items.description: Characters are clearly into each other but hilariously oblivious to it themselves.

items.name: In Vino Veritas (trope)
items.description: Drunken honesty—characters reveal feelings or secrets while under the influence.

items.name: Inflation
items.description: A kink or sci-fi trope where a body part (often belly or breasts) is magically, medically, or sexually inflated.

items.name: Jealousy (trope)
items.description: One character is jealous of another's interactions, used to reveal romantic feelings or cause drama.

items.name: Kemonomimi
items.description: A trope where characters have animal ears and sometimes other animal traits, often blurring the line between human and animal.

items.name: Kidfic
items.description: A genre or trope where characters are portrayed as children or the focus is on child-rearing.

items.name: Kidnapping
items.description: A trope where one character is abducted or held captive, often leading to forced intimacy or power struggles.

items.name: Kissing Practice
items.description: A trope where characters practice kissing, often leading to romantic or awkward moments.

items.name: Last Kiss
items.description: A trope where two characters share a final, emotional kiss, often before a significant separation or death.

items.name: Let Me Be Weak, Let Me Sleep
items.description: A trope in which a character allows themselves to be vulnerable, typically in the presence of a trusted partner.

items.name: Lingerie
items.description: A trope focusing on the character wearing lingerie, often linked to sexual or romantic tension.

items.name: Locked in a Room
items.description: A trope where characters are trapped in a confined space, often leading to forced proximity and emotional or sexual tension.

items.name: Love at First Sight
items.description: A classic trope where two characters immediately fall in love upon meeting, usually without much prior interaction.

items.name: Love Confession
items.description: A trope where one character confesses their love to another, often leading to emotional or dramatic moments.

items.name: Love Quadrangle
items.description: A trope where four characters are involved in a complex web of romantic feelings and relationships.

items.name: Love Square
items.description: A trope where four characters are involved in a love square, with romantic feelings shifting between them.

items.name: Love Triangle
items.description: A common trope where two characters compete for the affection of a third character, often leading to tension and drama.

items.name: Love-Hate Relationship
items.description: A trope where two characters experience conflicting feelings, simultaneously loving and hating each other.

items.name: Loyalty Kink
items.description: A sexual trope where characters are turned on by loyalty, either through submission or domination, depending on the dynamics of the relationship.

items.name: Lubrication
items.description: A sexual trope that involves the use of lubrication, typically within explicit sexual contexts.

items.name: Magic
items.description: A trope where magic plays a central role, either as part of the world-building or as a plot device.

items.name: Mail-Order Bride
items.description: A trope where a character is sent away or purchased as a bride, often exploring themes of power dynamics and control.

items.name: Make Up
items.description: A trope where characters reconcile after a fight, often leading to physical intimacy or emotional resolution.

items.name: Marriage
items.description: A trope where characters marry, either out of love, necessity, or convenience, often creating new relationship dynamics.

items.name: Marriage of Convenience
items.description: A trope where characters enter into a marriage for practical reasons rather than love, often leading to romantic development.

items.name: Martial Arts
items.description: A genre or trope where characters engage in martial arts, often involving action, combat, and physical prowess.

items.name: Mary Sue
items.description: A trope where a character is overly perfect or idealized, often to the point of being unrealistic.

items.name: Massage
items.description: A trope where one character gives another a massage, often leading to romantic or sexual tension.

items.name: Masturbation
items.description: A sexual trope where a character masturbates, either for self-pleasure or as part of a scene with others.

items.name: Matchmaker
items.description: A trope where a character attempts to matchmake others, often causing chaos or leading to unexpected romantic outcomes.

items.name: Mating
items.description: A sexual trope often involving animalistic or primal instincts where characters mate, typically in explicit contexts.

items.name: Meaningful Name
items.description: A trope where a character's name has symbolic or significant meaning, often related to their personality or role.

items.name: Mind Control
items.description: A trope where one character has the ability to control another's thoughts or actions, often leading to complex power dynamics.

items.name: Mindfuck
items.description: A trope where characters experience intense psychological manipulation, confusion, or disorientation.

items.name: Misunderstandings
items.description: A trope where a lack of communication or misunderstanding causes problems between characters, often leading to drama or conflict.

items.name: Obsession
items.description: A trope where one character becomes obsessed with another, often leading to unhealthy or possessive behavior.

items.name: One Night Stand
items.description: A trope where characters have a single sexual encounter, often without any expectation of a lasting relationship.

items.name: Opposites Attract
items.description: A trope where two characters with contrasting personalities or traits are drawn to each other, often leading to romantic or sexual tension.

items.name: Partner Betrayal
items.description: A trope where one character betrays their romantic or sexual partner, often leading to drama or conflict.

items.name: Pining
items.description: A trope where a character is in love with someone who doesn't reciprocate the feelings, leading to emotional turmoil.

items.name: Presumed Dead
items.description: A trope where a character is believed to be dead, only to return later, often leading to emotional reunions and dramatic moments.

items.name: Platonic Life Partners
items.description: A trope where two characters form a deep bond, often in a non-romantic or non-sexual way, and live together as life partners.

items.name: Polyamory
items.description: A relationship structure where one person has romantic or sexual relationships with multiple partners simultaneously, with everyone's consent.

items.name: Redeeming Love
items.description: A trope where one character seeks to redeem themselves through love, often involving significant personal growth and sacrifice.

items.name: Redemption
items.description: A trope where a character seeks redemption for past actions, often leading to a romantic or emotional resolution.

items.name: Reunion
items.description: A trope where characters are reunited after a long separation, often leading to an emotional and sometimes romantic resolution.

items.name: Rebound Romance
items.description: A trope where a character starts a new romantic relationship as a way to get over a previous one, often leading to complications.

items.name: Road Trip
items.description: A trope where characters embark on a journey together, often leading to self-discovery, bonding, or romantic tension.

items.name: Resurrection
items.description: A trope where a character is brought back to life, often leading to emotional turmoil or a new sense of purpose.

items.name: Rude Interruption
items.description: A trope where a romantic or intimate moment is interrupted in a way that causes tension or embarrassment.

items.name: Reverse Harem
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where one character is romantically involved with multiple others, typically with a focus on one protagonist and several love interests.

items.name: Scars
items.description: A trope where characters bear physical or emotional scars, often used to symbolize past trauma, personal growth, or inner conflict.

items.name: Secret Relationship
items.description: A trope where characters maintain a relationship in secrecy, often leading to tension, emotional turmoil, and dramatic reveals.

items.name: Severitus
items.description: A trope, often used in fanfiction, where a character (usually a mentor figure) reveals an important secret about their past or identity to the protagonist.

items.name: Silvertongue
items.description: A trope where a character possesses exceptional persuasion skills, often using their charm to manipulate others or win their favor.

items.name: Soulbond
items.description: A trope where two characters share a mystical, often emotional, bond that ties them together in ways that cannot be easily severed.

items.name: Soulmate Marks
items.description: A trope where characters are marked by a visible or invisible sign that indicates they are soulmates, often leading to inevitable romantic connections.

items.name: Soulmates
items.description: A trope where characters are fated to be together, often featuring a deep, predestined connection that transcends time or circumstance.

items.name: Slipstream
items.description: A trope that involves blending elements of different genres or styles, creating a unique or experimental narrative.

items.name: Slow Burn
items.description: A trope where the romantic or emotional tension builds gradually over time, often culminating in a significant, explosive payoff.

items.name: Terms of Endearment
items.description: A trope where characters use affectionate or intimate names for each other, often as a way to show closeness and emotional connection.

items.name: The Brass Bed
items.description: A trope where two characters engage in a passionate, intimate encounter, often in an unconventional or risky setting.

items.name: Trapped Together
items.description: A trope where characters are forced to spend time together in a confined space, often leading to bonding, conflict, or romantic tension.

items.name: Teacher/Student
items.description: An AU where one character is a teacher and the other a student, often exploring forbidden relationships, power dynamics, and ethical dilemmas.

items.name: Time Travel
items.description: An AU where characters travel through time, often leading to complex narratives involving historical events, future possibilities, and paradoxes.

items.name: Torture
items.description: An AU where characters are subjected to physical or psychological torment, often explored for its emotional impact or themes of resistance and survival.

items.name: Touring
items.description: An AU where characters are part of a touring band, theatrical company, or similar traveling group, often leading to camaraderie, romance, and conflict.

items.name: Trapped in Another World
items.description: An AU where characters are transported to a different world, often featuring fantasy, adventure, and the characters' struggle to adapt.

items.name: Trapped In Elevator
items.description: An AU where characters become stuck in an elevator, often leading to emotional or romantic developments as they confront their isolation.

items.name: Servantfic
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where one or more characters are servants, often exploring themes of power dynamics, submission, and loyalty.

items.name: Served in Combat
items.description: An AU where characters are involved in military service, often exploring themes of camaraderie, battle, and the psychological effects of combat.

items.name: Single Parent
items.description: An AU where characters are single parents, often exploring the challenges of raising a child while managing a personal or romantic life.

items.name: Erotica
items.description: Narratives focused heavily on sexual content and exploration without necessarily involving romance.

items.name: Fan Service
items.description: Scenes or dialogue added solely to titillate the audience, often breaking realism to indulge fantasies.

items.name: PWP
items.description: Short for 'Plot? What Plot?', a trope where the focus is on explicit sexual encounters rather than a detailed plot.

items.name: Skit
items.description: A genre focused on short, humorous, or dramatic scenes, often featuring witty dialogue or absurd situations.

items.name: Slice of Life
items.description: A genre that depicts the everyday lives of characters, often focusing on mundane but emotionally significant moments.

items.name: Tragedy
items.description: A genre that centers on sorrow, loss, and despair, often leading to a poignant or heartbreaking conclusion.

items.name: Action/Adventure
items.description: Stories focused on exciting physical action or high-stakes adventure, often with battles or missions.

items.name: Angst
items.description: Emotionally intense stories often featuring pain, heartbreak, or trauma.

items.name: Coming of Age (genre)
items.description: Stories that follow a character's emotional or psychological growth from youth to maturity.

items.name: Dark Romance (genre)
items.description: Romantic stories with morally gray characters, power imbalances, or taboo dynamics.

items.name: Drama (genre)
items.description: Emotionally intense narratives with interpersonal conflict and character development.

items.name: Erotica
items.description: Narratives focused primarily on explicit sexual content, often with minimal plot.

items.name: Fluff
items.description: Lighthearted, feel-good content with low conflict and lots of affection.

items.name: Mystery (genre)
items.description: Stories revolving around a mystery to be solved—can include romance or smut.

items.name: Romance
items.description: Central focus on a romantic relationship, from meet-cute to full-blown love story.

items.name: Slice of Life (genre)
items.description: Realistic depictions of everyday experiences and relationships, often domestic and character-driven.

items.name: Action/Adventure
items.description: Stories focused on exciting physical action or high-stakes adventure, often with battles or missions.

items.name: Angst
items.description: Emotionally intense stories often featuring pain, heartbreak, or trauma.

items.name: Anywhere But Here (genre)

items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where a royal character rejects or defies their royal duties, often exploring themes of rebellion and personal freedom.

items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are placed in the Regency period, often with themes of high society, romance, and manners.

items.name: Retail AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters work in a retail environment, often leading to humorous, quirky, or romantic situations.

items.name: Reverse Age AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters’ ages are reversed, such as an older character becoming younger or vice versa.

items.name: Rock Star AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are re-imagined as rock stars or musicians, exploring fame, romance, and the rock-and-roll lifestyle.

items.name: Roommates AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are roommates, often leading to romantic tension, misunderstandings, and personal growth.

items.name: Royalty AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are royalty, often focusing on power dynamics, politics, and romantic drama.

items.name: Runaway AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters run away from home, often for adventure, self-discovery, or to escape certain pressures.

items.name: Sailor Moon AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) based on the 'Sailor Moon' universe, where characters take on roles inspired by the series.

items.name: Same Age AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are all the same age, altering the dynamics of their relationships and experiences.

items.name: Actor AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are actors, often exploring fame, the entertainment industry, and romantic entanglements.

items.name: Serial Killer AU
items.description: An Alternate Universe (AU) where characters are either serial killers or involved in a crime-based narrative, often focusing on suspense and dark themes.

items.name: Shapeshifter
items.description: An AU where characters have the ability to transform into different creatures or forms, often leading to exploration of identity, freedom, or power.

items.name: Shinsengumi
items.description: An AU where characters are re-imagined as members of the Shinsengumi, a group of samurai in 19th-century Japan, often focusing on honor, duty, and historical conflicts.

items.name: Slavefic
items.description: An AU where characters are enslaved or treated as property, often delving into power dynamics, resistance, and liberation.

items.name: Social Media AU
items.description: An AU where characters interact primarily through social media, often focusing on modern communication, internet culture, and virtual relationships.

items.name: Space AU
items.description: An AU set in space, often featuring futuristic technology, space exploration, and intergalactic adventure.

items.name: Spies
items.description: An AU where characters are spies or involved in espionage, often involving covert operations, secret missions, and high-stakes action.

items.name: Steampunk
items.description: An AU set in an alternate history where steam power drives technology, often blending Victorian aesthetics with advanced machinery and adventure.

items.name: Sugar Daddy AU
items.description: An AU where one character is financially dominant or supports another character, often leading to themes of power, wealth, and dependency.

items.name: Tattoo Parlor AU
items.description: An AU where characters work or interact in a tattoo parlor, often exploring artistic expression, body modification, and intimate relationships.
